document.docAuthor: Saini, Malkiat S. & Parey, Sajad H.
document.masterDocTitle: Four new species of the genus Lepidostoma Rambur (Trichoptera: Lepidostomatidae) from the Indian Himalayas, with a checklist to its Indian species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Four new species of the genus Lepidostoma Rambur (Trichoptera: Lepidostomatidae) from the Indian Himalayas, with a checklist to its Indian species

subSubSection.paragraph:
1 . Lepidostoma armatum
(Ulmer). India (Assam).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Dinarthrum armatum
Ulmer 1905
: 60
–70, figs. 28–31, 3 . “ India : Assam” (Vienna Museum, Austria ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
2 . Lepidostoma assamense
(Mosely). India (Meghalaya), Nepal , Bhutan .
Anacrunoecia assamense
Mosely 1949 b
: 412
–413, pl. 1 figs. 85–92, 3 . “Meghalaya: Cherrapunge” (Natural History Museum, London, UK .)
Malicky 2006
: 241–264 (reported from Nepal ).

Malicky 2007
: 498 (reported from Bhutan )

Additional material examined: Meghalaya, Shillong, 1500 m ,
63, 1
Ƥ.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:

: 286
–288, figs. 57–59, 3 “West Bengal: Darjeeling, 1500 m ” (Russian Institute of Zoology, St. Petersburg, Russia ). Additional material examined: Sikkim: Singhik, 1300 m , 13, 4 Ƥ; Mangan, 1500 m , 1 3 .

subSubSection.paragraph:

–36, 3.

subSubSection.paragraph:
“West Bengal: Darjeeling, 1500m ,” (Paris Museum, France ).

: 498 (reported from Bhutan ).

–295, figs. 66–67, 3 . “West Bengal: Darjeeling, 1500 m ” (Russian Institute of Zoology, St. Petersburg, Russia ).

: 241–264 (reported from Nepal ).

Additional material examined: Uttarakhand: Pithoragarh, 2100 m , 13. 10 .

sp. nov.

11 . Lepidostoma inerme

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:

: 5

subSubSection.paragraph:

Additional material examined: Jammu & Kashmir: Pahalgam, 2100 m , 153, 16 Ƥ; Dobivan, 2100 m , 13 ; Leh, 3500 m , 43 ; Gulmarg, 2700 m , 83 ; Himachal Pradesh: Traila, 2000 m , 13, 1 #.
